commercialUse.description: Determines if the licensee can make money from using the original IP Asset

commercialAttribution.description: If true, people must give credit to the original work in their commercial application

derivativesAllowed.description: Indicates whether the licensee can create derivatives of the work

derivativesApproval.description: If true, the licensor must approve derivatives of the work

derivativesReciprocal.description: If true, derivatives must have the exact same terms

disabled.description: If true, the license terms will be disabled. Effectively preventing future mints with this license.

items.description: Response schema for PIL terms

recipient.description: Recipient of the items being purchased. You can specify a wallet address or email, either explicitly or using a 'locator'. If you pass an email, Crossmint will create a custodial wallet address for the user on the fly, that they can later log in to. If no recipient is passed, an order will be created with the status 'missing-recipient', until you pass one.

recipient.description:
An address locator that supports different types of recipients. It can be of the format:
- `<address>` (wallet address)
- `chain:address` (e.g. ethereum:0x1234...)
- `address:<blockchain_address>[:chain]`
- `email:<email_address>[:chain]`
- `phoneNumber:<phone_number>[:chain]`
- `twitter:<twitter_handle>[:chain]`
- `x:<twitter_handle>[:chain]`
- `userId:<user_id>[:chain]`

crossmintUserLocator.description:
A internal locator for the creator of the IP asset, crossmint will automatically map this to the correct wallet address, not required if address is specified, is always required for the main creator(owner): Allowed formats: 

`<chain>:<address>` or 

`email:<email_address>:<chain>` or

`userId:<userId>:<chain>` or

`twitter:<twitter_handle>:<chain>`

[see here for more info](/minting/advanced/specify-recipient)

crossmintUserLocator.description:
A internal locator for the creator of the IP asset, crossmint will automatically map this to the correct wallet address, not required if address is specified, is always required for the main creator(owner): Allowed formats: 

`<chain>:<address>` or 

`email:<email_address>:<chain>` or

`userId:<userId>:<chain>` or

`twitter:<twitter_handle>:<chain>`
